body_html:
I don't think feeding the time to the initializer would work since the time changes every time step. we can concatenate the time with the feature tensor and pass a single input tensor. in practice we pass the time as a feature.
…
On Fri, Sep 29, 2017 at 5:12 PM, Eugene Brevdo ***@***.***> wrote: Right. CC'ing author of PhasedLSTMCell to discuss feasibility of moving the time component into the state; and modifying the initializer to accept optional initial time & time delta arguments. On Thu, Sep 28, 2017 at 10:21 PM, bingo619 ***@***.***> wrote: > Sorry, do you mean instead of feeding the time in a tuple, feed it to the > initializer? I think if we can do that, that should work. > > I find feeding tuple input is a disaster anyway, it does't work with > bidirectional_dynamic_rnn either, I had to write my own. > > And it is the same problem when implementing other time variance RNNs, > like this one https://www.ijcai.org/proceedings/2017/504 > > — > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <#11144 (comment)>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim4uqM53gqiWiXtJM_n3wo-tKhtDKks5snH5wgaJpZM4OJm39> > . >
body_text:
I don't think feeding the time to the initializer would work since the time
changes every time step.
we can concatenate the time with the feature tensor and pass a single input
tensor.
in practice we pass the time as a feature.
…
On Fri, Sep 29, 2017 at 5:12 PM, Eugene Brevdo ***@***.***> wrote:
 Right.  CC'ing author of PhasedLSTMCell to discuss feasibility of moving
 the time component into the state; and modifying the initializer to accept
 optional initial time & time delta arguments.

 On Thu, Sep 28, 2017 at 10:21 PM, bingo619 ***@***.***>
 wrote:

> Sorry, do you mean instead of feeding the time in a tuple, feed it to the
> initializer? I think if we can do that, that should work.
>
> I find feeding tuple input is a disaster anyway, it does't work with
> bidirectional_dynamic_rnn either, I had to write my own.
>
> And it is the same problem when implementing other time variance RNNs,
> like this one https://www.ijcai.org/proceedings/2017/504
>
> —

body:
I don't think feeding the time to the initializer would work since the time
changes every time step.
we can concatenate the time with the feature tensor and pass a single input
tensor.
in practice we pass the time as a feature.

On Fri, Sep 29, 2017 at 5:12 PM, Eugene Brevdo <ebrevdo@google.com> wrote:

> Right.  CC'ing author of PhasedLSTMCell to discuss feasibility of moving
> the time component into the state; and modifying the initializer to accept
> optional initial time & time delta arguments.
>
> On Thu, Sep 28, 2017 at 10:21 PM, bingo619 <notifications@github.com>
> wrote:
>
>> Sorry, do you mean instead of feeding the time in a tuple, feed it to the
>> initializer? I think if we can do that, that should work.
>>
>> I find feeding tuple input is a disaster anyway, it does't work with
>> bidirectional_dynamic_rnn either, I had to write my own.
>>
>> And it is the same problem when implementing other time variance RNNs,
>> like this one https://www.ijcai.org/proceedings/2017/504
>>
>> —
